intro: Sympieza capitellata var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sympieza, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
